summary: The bill, titled the District of Columbia One Vote One Choice Act, aims to amend the Help America Vote Act of 2002 to prohibit the District of Columbia from using ranked-choice voting in its elections. It amends the original act by adding a new section specifically preventing the use of ranked-choice voting in all District of Columbia elections, including those for federal offices and on ballot initiatives. It also makes conforming and clerical amendments to update relevant sections.
